indications: Indications treatment and prevention of postmenopausal osteoporosis
name: RALOXIFENE HYDROCHLORIDE
cautions:
Cautions risk factors for venous thromboembolism
(discontinue if prolonged immobilisation); risk factors for stroke; breast cancer (
(From Raloxifene: British National Formulary)
Raloxifene); history of oestrogen-induced
hypertriglyceridaemia (monitor serum triglycerides);
avoid in acute porphyria (%s
(From 9.8.2 Acute porphyrias: British National Formulary)
9.8.2 Acute porphyrias); interactions: Appendix 1 (raloxifene)
side-effects:
Side-effects hot flushes, leg cramps, peripheral oedema, influenza-like
symptoms; less commonly venous thromboembolism, thrombophlebitis; rarely rashes, gastro-intestinal disturbances, hypertension,
arterial thromboembolism, headache (including migraine), breast discomfort,
thrombocytopenia
